title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum: Community split between capped supply and deflationary model - Cointelegraph
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) are in a debate over which cryptocurrency is more sound, with proponents of both sides presenting arguments. Ultra Sound Money, an Ethereum-focused Twitter user, compared the two cryptocurrencies' supply issuance and suggested that ETH's deflationary model makes it sounder. However, BTC proponents argue that soundness comes from the credibility of the monetary policy, not an ever-changing one. They also pointed out that Ethereum's monetary policy has changed multiple times in the past, while Bitcoin has not. In response, Ethereum educator Anthony Sassano claimed that every change on the Ethereum network has been approved by node operators, and Leo Glisic stated that ETH has become sound money now, but BTC won't hit its cap until 2140. The debate highlights the ongoing discussion around the merits of capped versus deflationary supply models in the context of cryptocurrency.

title: Ethereum once again has become deflationary, here’s how - AMBCrypto News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum has become deflationary again, with its annualized inflation rate dropping to 0.00002%. This means that the rate of new ETH being added to the supply is decreasing. The value of ETH has risen by 31% since the start of the year, and daily transaction settlements on the Ethereum network have surpassed $21 billion, significantly higher than Bitcoin's $2.6 billion. There has also been a resurgence of new ETH smart contracts being created, indicating strong developer activity and interest in the platform. The Shanghai Upgrade is estimated to occur before the end of Q1 2023, which could further boost the network's activity and growth.

title: $600,000,000 in Liquidations Hit Short Sellers As Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH) and Altcoins Pop - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

$600 million in liquidations have hit short sellers in the crypto market, with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and altcoins experiencing significant gains. Liquidations have reached $180 million in the last 24 hours alone, with Bitcoin and Ethereum accounting for the majority of these figures. Short sellers have been hit with over $600 million in liquidations since January 13th, according to CoinGlass data. The article also highlights the performance of several altcoins, including Solana and Aptos, which have seen significant gains in the last week.

title: How I Built an Anonymous Voting System on the Ethereum Blockchain Using Zero-Knowledge Proof - hackernoon.com
summary: In this article, the author describes how they built an anonymous voting system on the Ethereum blockchain using zero-knowledge proofs. The system allows voters to prove that they cast a vote without revealing any information about their vote, ensuring privacy and security. The author explains the technical details of how they implemented the system, highlighting the use of zero-knowledge proofs and smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain. The article concludes by discussing the potential applications of this technology in various industries, including politics and finance.

title: Lazarus Group Moves 41,000 Ethereum Nabbed From Harmony Bridge Hack - Decrypt
summary: Lazarus Group, a North Korea-linked cybercrime syndicate, has moved $63.4 million in Ethereum from the Harmony bridge hack, depositing it on Binance, Huobi, and OKX exchanges. The group used the privacy and anonymity system Railgun to obscure the nature of the crypto transactions. Binance and Huobi detected the funds' movements and froze them, recovering 124 Bitcoin. The attackers had originally made the illegitimate transfers in ETH, which could have been swapped for BTC at multiple points during the mixing and consolidating process. This is not the first time Lazarus has been implicated in a major hack, with previous attacks including the Ronin Network and a scheme to spread malware to crypto-related firms.

title: Ethereum’s latest update could get ETH holders excited for 2023 because… - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum's latest update has sparked excitement among investors, with the total value of ETH staked and validators on the network experiencing significant growth. The number of validators increased by 0.61% over a seven-day period, and revenue from transaction fees surged by almost 24%. The annualized reward rate for validators is estimated at 3.8%. Whale transactions also saw a sharp increase, with the velocity indicator indicating that ETH is moving more frequently across wallets. However, investors are cautious about the potential impact of the Shanghai Upgrade on the market.

title: XRP Community Has Hatred for All Things Ethereum, Charles Gasparino Claims - U.Today
summary: XRP community has a strong dislike for all things Ethereum, according to Charles Gasparino, a media personality and correspondent with FOX Business Network. Despite this, many Ethereum holders want XRP to win its ongoing lawsuit with the SEC, which could have significant implications for the entire industry. Gasparino's view differs from that of the community, who believe that Ethereum maximalists have been consistently dismissive of XRP. Vitalik Buterin, the founder of Ethereum, has previously called XRP a "shitcoin," which has contributed to the animosity between the two camps.

title: Ric Burton received 10k ETH from Buterin for a month of work in 2014 - CryptoSlate
summary: Ric Burton, a web designer, shared on Twitter how he received 10,000 Ether (ETH) from Vitalik Buterin in 2016 as compensation for a month of work in 2014. Burton joined the Ethereum community after hearing Gavin Wood's speech and eventually worked with Buterin on designing the platform. Despite leaving the community due to financial difficulties, Burton received the payment years later after repeatedly asking the Ethereum Foundation. The transaction helped Burton gain liquidity and pay off debts, allowing him to finally find financial stability.

title: Shiba Inu Developers Reveal First Look of Layer 2 Blockchain Shibarium - CoinDesk
summary: Shiba Inu developers unveiled the first look of Layer 2 blockchain Shibarium, focusing on metaverse and gaming apps, particularly as the NFT sector is expected to grow in the coming years. Shibarium aims to provide a cheap settlement for decentralized applications built on the network.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin above $21,000; crypto market cap nears $1 trillion - The Economic Times
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin price surges above $21,000, reaching a new high in over two months. Ethereum also sees a significant gain, trading above $1500. Crypto market cap reaches $1 trillion, with a 20% jump in Bitcoin and Ether prices in just seven days. Other top tokens also see gains, with Shiba Inu rising 6.3%. Experts attribute the market momentum to favorable macroeconomic factors and the successful containment of inflation by US central banks. Total crypto market cap stands at $993.26 billion, with DeFi and stablecoin volumes increasing.

title: Ahead of Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade, ETH Reach Big Milestone - CoinGape
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum (ETH) price is up 0.70% in the last 24 hours, reaching $1,544. The Shanghai upgrade is coming in March, and staked ETH will be open for withdrawals. Ethereum hit a major milestone with 500,000 active validators and 16 million ETH staked. Lido DAO token (LIDO) price doubled in recent days, benefitting from the anticipation around the Shanghai upgrade. Technical indicators suggest the next level of price resistance for ETH could be at $1,650.

title: SHIB Team Says Layer-2 Network Shibarium to Launch ‘Soon’ - Decrypt
summary: The Shiba Inu team has announced the upcoming beta release of Shibarium, a layer-2 network that will operate on top of Ethereum. Shibarium will reportedly minimize costs and increase transaction speeds, but the exact number of transactions per second has not been disclosed. The network will be operated and secured by validators and delegators who stake their tokens to receive rewards, with the new TREAT token to be launched soon. The announcement also outlined a new SHIB burning mechanism that will replace the previous Burn Portal, and SHIB token jumped 2.5% over the last day and 20% amid the wider crypto market's rally.

title: How to Read Crypto Transactions on Etherscan? Explained! - Watcher Guru
summary: Etherscan is a platform that allows users to track and analyze transactions on the Ethereum blockchain. It provides a simple way to search for crypto wallet or token addresses and view transaction data, including the transaction hash, status, from and to addresses, value, and fee. Etherscan is an independent organization and does not receive funding from the Ethereum foundation. Users can easily access the Ethereum blockchain through Etherscan, making it a useful tool for crypto enthusiasts.

title: Shiba Inu developers expected to unveil Ethereum-based Shibarium - The Financial Express
summary: Shiba Inu developers are set to unveil Shibarium, a layer-2 network built on Ethereum, aimed at revolutionizing the Shiba ecosystem. The update is expected to remove barriers for small transactions, increase speed, enable decentralized applications (dApps), and integrate non-fungible tokens (NFTs). The developers have emphasized that the project's focus is not on price-pumping, and all transactions on the network will have an implicit burn amount for SHIB token. The team has not provided an official timeline for the release, but has indicated that the answer to all questions regarding the time frame is "soon." Additionally, Shiba Inu developers have been approached by the World Economic Forum (WEF) to partner on developing a global policy on the metaverse, and intend to work with other technology companies such as Facebook and Decentraland.

title: Martin Lewis issues urgent warning to stop Brits losing money and being targeted by criminals – here’s how... - The Sun
summary: Martin Lewis, a money saving expert, has issued an urgent warning to Brits about a new scam using his name and face. Criminals are using adverts and promoted posts on social media to trick people into investing in fake schemes. Lewis advises people to always check if he has approved any investment opportunity on his website, MoneySavingExpert.com, and to be suspicious of any "too good to be true" offers. He also recommends reporting any scams and seeking independent advice before making any financial decisions.

title: Ethereum beaten in Daily Transfer Count by Arbitrum and Optimism combined - The Coin Republic
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's daily transaction count has been beaten by L2 scaling networks Arbitrum and Optimism combined. In January 2023, Ethereum managed 1.10 million transactions, while Arbitrum and Optimism combined managed 1.32 million. This is a significant increase from the same time last year, when Ethereum managed 1.17 million transactions and Arbitrum and Optimism combined managed 21,734 and 30,430 transactions per day, respectively. The growth in L2 transactions is attributed to lower on-chain fees and increased popularity of L2 scaling solutions.
